intro: Hexatheca fulva subsp. beamanii, commonly known as the Beaman's hexatheca, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has simple, opposite leaves and produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
